an5.176:4.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, escorted by five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha,
an5.176:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an5.176:5.1: “Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.176:5.2: But you should not be content with just this much.
an5.176:5.4: So you should train like this:
an5.176:5.5: ‘How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?’
an5.176:6.1: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha:
an5.176:6.3: How well said this was by the Buddha:
an5.176:6.4: ‘Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.176:6.5: But you should not be content with just this much.
an5.176:6.7: So you should train like this:
an5.176:6.8: “How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?”
an5.176:6.10: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.
an5.176:6.11: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:6.12: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:6.13: The pain and sadness connected with the unwholesome.
an5.176:6.14: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unwholesome.
an5.176:6.15: The pain and sadness connected with the wholesome.
an5.176:6.16: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”
an5.176:7.2: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.
an5.176:7.3: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:7.4: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:7.5: The pain and sadness connected with the unwholesome.
an5.176:7.6: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unwholesome.
an5.176:7.7: The pain and sadness connected with the wholesome.
an5.176:7.8: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”
